name: Northstrand Harbour
role_in_state: Primary northern shipyard and trade hub
economy_niches: ship repair, fitting and small craft construction
timber milling and maritime timber trade
culture_adjustments: Guild authority stronger; local guilds control quays and pilot licenses
Sea-clan kinship networks supplant some inland lineage ties
Market cosmopolitanism includes frequent Island Creole traders
Practical ritualism: compact sea-safe rites used daily by crews
Apprenticeships accelerated for seasonal fishing and shipwork
risks: siltation and shoal growth at approaches
constraints: Shallow, shifting approaches limit large deep-draft vessels
Local ritual magic consumes imported reagents and pilot labor
Quays require continual maintenance against rot and tide
notes: Key node for State_1's maritime trade and augury services
Augury houses double as pilot stations; fees fund quay upkeep
Glassworks use abundant sea-sand; salted-fish exports seasonally peak
